title: Bristol student accommodation fire was accidental
text:
Firefighters who tackled the huge fire which broke out in student accomodation in Bristol this week have concluded that the fire started accidentally.
Crews were called on Monday afternoon to reports of a serious fire. On arrival they found the fire affecting the fifth floor and roof space of the building.
Watch: huge fire causes chaos in central Bristol The roof of the Colston St building was totally destroyed. Credit: ITV West Country An investigation into the cause of the fire determined that the fire started accidentally after a pan of oil was left unattended in a kitchen area.
Whilst this was undoubtedly a dramatic and extremely traumatic incident for those involved and affected, thankfully no one was injured. The alarms activated allowing all the students inside to safely evacuate and staff to follow their well-managed fire evacuation plan. Although the building was badly damaged the presence of the alarms undoubtedly saved lives that day.
– Station Manager Steve Quinton Our overriding concern was for the safety of our students and we’re very thankful that no one was injured. We were able to rehouse everyone quickly and continue to support them after what was undoubtedly a traumatic experience.
– Lynn Robinson, Deputy Registrar at the University of Bristol Last updated Wed 14 Oct 2015 Read more 9 updates Huge blaze in Bristol centre Travel Bristol
